export_format.description: Export is a ZIP file whose contents vary by product version and configuration. Configuration 1 (newer platforms: Expanse, 6.1x, 6.08 Acute, C/S Acute, MAGIC Acute) produces eChart documents (images/PDFs organized by category/subcategory), US Core FHIR R4 JSON bundle (Patient $everything), C-CDA XML documents, and supplemental reports as text/PDF (financial, immunizations, auth/referral, utilization review). Configuration 2 (older platforms: 6.08 Ambulatory, C/S, MAGIC) additionally includes patient data as CSV files mapped to internal database tables, plus scanned external documents/images. Both configurations include a Table of Contents in NDJSON format using FHIR DocumentReference resources as metadata.

documentation.table_or_resource_count_note: 3 PDF data dictionaries document CSV tables for Configuration 2 only. The 6.08 PDF covers ~50+ distinct tables, C/S PDF covers ~200+ tables, MAGIC PDF covers ~200+ tables. Configuration 1 documentation is structural (describes folder/file layout) without field-level CSV schemas.

clinical.evidence: Electronic Chart documents (images/PDFs), Structured Clinical Documents (C-CDA), FHIR Resource Bundle (US Core Patient $everything), Lab results (LabSpecimens, LabSpecimenTests), Microbiology (MicSpecimens), Pathology (PthSpecimens), Nursing documentation (Nur*), Radiology (ItsOrder*, RadExam*), Problems (HubPatientProblems, EpsProblems), Allergies (MriAllergies), Vital Signs, Ambulatory Results, Population Health

secure_messages.evidence: Provider Messages section (Provider Messages.txt or .pdf) containing 'Provider to Provider and Provider to Patient messaging'. Config2 also includes PbrMpiVisVisitsMessagesText table. Patient Notices section (Patient Notices.pdf) containing 'patient and physician interactive message'. AprEncMessages and AprEncMessagesLines tables in 6.08 CSV. EdmPatientNoteText table.

billing_financial.evidence: Financial Reports section (FinancialEHI.txt) with 'financial transactions for the patient'. PbrAccountTransactions, PbrAccountTxnPymntDistribution, PbrAccountTxnFinanceCharges, PbrAccountClaims, PbrAccountClaimsDetail, PbrAccountStatements, PbrAcctTxnDxs tables in CSV exports. ResidentTrustEHI.txt for resident trust financial transactions. CostEstimation.txt for cost estimates (Expanse only). Authorization & Referral Management Reports (ARMEHI) include InsEligCopayDeductData.pdf.

insurance_coverage.evidence: MriPatientInsurances, AdmInsurances/AdmInsuredData/AdmInsuredInfo tables with fields: InsuranceID, InsuranceBenefitPlan, CoverageNumber, InsuredGroupName, InsuredGroupNumber, InsuredPolicyNumber, InsuredRelationshipID, ElectronicCheck, TreatmentAuthorizationNumber. PbrAccountInsurance table. ARMEHI-InsEligCopayDeductData.pdf with insurance eligibility and deduction data. Copay/Deductible fields in CSV tables.

appointments_scheduling.evidence: SchAppointments table in all 3 CSV data dictionaries with fields: AppointmentID, AppointmentTypeID, ApptDate, ApptTime, ApptStatus, ApptSeqID. Extensive surgical scheduling tables: SchOrPatCase* (dozens of tables covering OR cases, vital signs, medications, implants, complications, anesthesia notes).

documents_images.evidence: Electronic Chart section contains categorized documents as images (png, jpg, tif, bmp) and PDFs organized in folder hierarchy. External Documents/Images (AmbScans folder) with scanned/imported documents in multiple formats (PDF, DOCX, TXT, MTDD, HTML, RTF, ODT, TIF, PNG, JPG, BMP, GIF). Point of Contact Scanned Documents. Clinical Reports including pathology reports with images. PthSpecimenPictures table. NurPlanOfCareTdImages.

audit_trails.evidence: PhaRxAuditDetailText table in C/S CSV (pharmacy audit trail). PbrMpiVisHlthMntItemsAudit in MAGIC CSV. PthSpecimenSignoutAuds (pathology signout audit). OeOrderEdits table tracks order modifications with OldValue/NewValue fields. EdmPatientDocumentSigHistory in MAGIC. However, no general system-wide access audit trail is documented.

issues: 'Regulatory EHI Export Functionality Guides' link at customer.meditech.com requires Keycloak SAML login - not publicly accessible
Configuration 1 (newer platforms including Expanse) lacks field-level CSV data dictionaries - documentation describes folder/file structure but not internal data schemas for the document-based export
No developer guide for processing exports
Data types not specified in CSV data dictionaries (only Field, Table, Column mappings)
Export content varies significantly by product version, installed modules, and organization configuration - making it hard to predict exact export contents
summary: MEDITECH provides solid EHI export documentation across a multi-page HTML site with three platform-specific PDF data dictionaries for CSV exports. The export is a ZIP file containing a mix of document files (PDFs, images), FHIR R4 JSON bundles (US Core Patient $everything), C-CDA XML, CSV data files (Configuration 2 only), and supplemental text/PDF reports covering financial transactions, insurance, messaging, immunizations, and more. The CSV data dictionaries for Configuration 2 (Client/Server, MAGIC, 6.08 platforms) provide field-level detail mapping hundreds of tables across clinical, financial, pharmacy, lab, radiology, scheduling, and administrative domains. Configuration 1 (Expanse and newer platforms) documentation is structural rather than schema-level. This is a genuine database-level export, not a FHIR API re-export - the CSV files map directly to internal MEDITECH database tables (Adm*, Pbr*, Pha*, Rxm*, Sch*, etc.) with internal identifiers and local codes.
